generif.text: cDNA cloning; the hPB1 gene is located on chromosome 3p21, where the tumor suppressor genes for breast, lung and kidney cancers have been mapped
We conclude that abnormalities of BAF180 are not frequently involved in the pathogenesis of lung cancer.
Results indicate that single bromodomains bind specific acetyl-lysine sites within the histone 3 tail with sub-micromolar affinity.
studies on how Pb1, and the broader class of bromodomain proteins, directs multisubunit chromatin remodeling complexes to specific acetyl-nucleosome sites
BAF180 suppresses tumorigenesis, at least in part, through its ability to regulate p21.
Bromodomain 2 of Polybromo protein preferentially recognizes acetylated lysine 14 of histone H3 (H3K14ac), a post-translational mark known for gene transcriptional activation.
Clinical trial of gene-disease association and gene-environment interaction. (HuGE Navigator)

as unique regulators of replicative senescence in human cells, both BRD7 and BAF180 regulate p53 transcriptional activity toward a subset of its target genes required for replicative and oncogenic stress senescence induction
Observational study of gene-disease association. (HuGE Navigator)
identification of the SWI/SNF chromatin remodelling complex gene PBRM1 (ref. 4) as a second major ccRCC cancer gene, with truncating mutations in 41% (92/227) of cases
PBRM1 was found to be mutated in 88 of 257 cases of clear cell renal cell carcinoma.
The role of syncytin-1 and Pb1 in cell-cell fusion was studied using lentiviral vectors that express short hairpin RNAs for stable knockdown of both genes.
Functional inactivation of PBRM1 in the context of VHL loss-of-function may represent a key event in the development of an aggressive tumor behavior.

The median overall survival in the UTSW cohort was significantly shorter for patients with BAP1-mutant tumours (4.6 years; 95% CI 2.1-7.2), than for patients with PBRM1-mutant tumours (10.6 years; 9.8-11.5).
PBRM1, KDM6A, SETD2 and BAP1 were unmethylated in all tumor and normal specimens.

the evidence that implicated PBRM1 and BAP1 as renal cancer driver genes, provide an update on the function of the gene products, and speculate on how mutations in these genes may be exploited therapeutically.
Mutation frequencies among CT images of clear cell RCCs were as follows: PBRM1, 28.8% (67 of 233).
PBRM1-negative expression is a markedly poor prognosis event in clear cell renal cell carcinoma.
PBRM1 (33%) mutations were identified in ccRCCs.
Frequent inactivating mutations in multiple chromatin-remodeling genes (including BAP1, ARID1A and PBRM1), and mutation in one of these genes occurred in almost half of the carcinomas sequenced.
Data demonstrate a function for BAF180 in promoting genome stability that is distinct from its well-characterized role in transcriptional regulation.

Of the 23 epithelioid sarcoma cases, 19 showed a loss of PBRM1, and 18 a loss of INI1. In 17 cases, loss of both proteins was observed. The pattern of PBRM1 expression was similar to that of INI1: not correlated with changes in cellular morphology.

Data suggest biallelic inactivation of PBRM1 or BAP1 is less common in non-ccRCC when compared with ccRCC tumors. Findings suggest loss of PBRM1 or BAP1 are key events in ccRCC, whereas other pathways may support tumorigenesis in non-ccRCC subtypes.
We report, for the first time, co-inactivation and frequent mutations of SMARCB1, SMARCA2 and PBRM1 in MRTs.
The subsequent validation study on 68 LCBs identified recurrent mutations in TERT promoter, chromatin regulators (BAP1, PBRM1 and ARID2), a synapse organization gene (PCLO), IDH genes and KRAS.
It evaluates the PB1 domain proteins as a family in the context of multiple phenotypic readouts in EC function as well as evaluate them as drug targets against disease.
We show for the first time that an inherited mutation in PBRM1 predisposes to RCC.
PBRM1 could block the G2/M transition by repressing cyclin B1. The data indicated that PBRM1 functions as a tumor suppressor in bladder cancer by repressing cyclin B1 expression.
Decreased expression of PBRM1 predicts unfavorable clinical outcome in patients with ccRCC.
The expression of BAF180 promotes UV-induced PCNA ubiquitination during S phase.
our data describe a close interrelation between p53 and PBRM1 in renal cell carcinomas
PBRM1 expression identified 4 clinical subgroups of patients with clear cell renal cell carcinoma who had divergent clinical outcomes.
Use bioinformatic tools to predict the molecular effects of all mutations lying in PBRM1 genes.
PBRM1 might involve in the development and progression of breast cancer as a tumor suppressor, and thereby may be a valuable prognostic marker for breast cancer patients.
Functionally, suppression of PBRM1 expression promoted cell proliferation and cell cycle progression
PBRM1 gene deletion is associated with chordoma.

PBRM1 re-expression led to upregulation of genes involved in cellular adhesion, carbohydrate metabolism, apoptotic process and response to hypoxia, and a downregulation of genes involved in different stages of cell division.
Synthetic lethality screening identifies TIP60-dependent radiation sensitivity in the absence of BAF180.

our integrative analysis suggested that methylation and miRNA alterations were likely the downstream events associated with PBRM1 truncation mutations.  In summary, this study provided some important insights into the understanding of tumorigenesis driven by PBRM1 truncated mutations in Clear cell renal cell carcinoma (ccRCC). The approach may be applied to many driver genes in various cancers.
BAP1 and PBRM1 loss is seen frequently in intrahepatic cholangiocarcinoma
PBRM1 mutation is associated with small Cell Lung Cancer.

conclude that four of the BDs act together to target PBRM1 to sites on chromatin; when a single BD is mutated, PBRM1 no longer controls gene expression properly, leading to increased cell proliferation

Clear-cell renal carcinoma cell lines whose ability to proliferate in vitro and in vivo is sensitive to wild-type BAF180, but not a tumor-associated BAF180 mutant, showed that the growth suppression by BAF180 is linked to its ability to form a canonical PBAF complex containing BRG1 that dampens the HIF transcriptional signature.
kidney-specific deletion of Vhl and Pbrm1, but not either gene alone, results in bilateral, multifocal, transplantable clear cell kidney cancers.
These findings indicate that PBRM1 mutation (and resultant loss of expression) is a late event during biliary carcinogenesis
These findings indicate that PBRM1 alters cell cycle progression and inhibits proliferation and migration of renal cell carcinoma ACHN cells through the chemokine/chemokine receptor pathway.

Knockdown of PBRM1 in colon cancer cells increased the expression of two receptor genes (RIG-I and MDA5) and upregulated interferon (IFN)-related and inflammation-related gene signatures. Lower PBRM1 expression was associated with advanced pathological grade and poorer survival of colorectal cancer (CRC) patients, indicating that PBRM1 could serve as a potential prognostic biomarker for CRC.
Study suggests that reduced expression of PBRM1 and VHL in clear cell renal cell carcinoma is correlated with an increased tumor aggressiveness.
Low PBRM1 expression is associated with early stages of clear cell renal cell carcinoma.

The biochemical and mutational analyses have identified bromodomain, BD4 as being critically important for maintaining proper PBRM1 function and demonstrate that BD4 mutations increase clear cell renal cell carcinoma cell growth.
Decreased expression of PBRM1 is correlated with poor prognosis and advanced clinicopathological features in patients with renal cell carcinoma (RCC).
Mechanisms of resistance to rapamycin analogs in renal cell carcinoma remain unclear and study results suggest that PBRM1 loss may contribute to sensitivity through complex transcriptional effects.
In intrahepatic cholangiocarcinoma retained expression of BAP-1 and PBRM-1, and an overexpression of S100P are related to a poor prognosis.
Bromodomains 2, 4, and 5 of PBRM1 collaborate to generate high affinity to acetylated histone H3 lysine and tether PBRM1 to chromatin.
we show a strong relationship between the expression profiles of PBRM1, BAP1 and SETD2 in ccRCC suggesting reciprocal synergy effects in the context of tumor suppression.

Study identified PBRM1 as a reader for p53 acetylation on lysine 382 (K382Ac) through its bromodomain 4 (BD4). Mutations on key residues of BD4 disrupt recognition of p53 K382Ac and reduces p53 binding to promoters of target genes such as CDKN1A (p21). PBRM1 BD4 mutant fails to fully support p53 transcriptional activity and is defective as a tumor suppressor.

PBRM1 and the glycosylphosphatidylinositol biosynthetic pathway promote tumor killing mediated by MHC-unrestricted cytotoxic lymphocytes.
Whole genome sequencing of skull-base chordoma reveals genomic alterations associated with recurrence and chordoma-specific survival.

PBRM1 Cooperates with YTHDF2 to Control HIF-1alpha Protein Translation.
PBRM1 loss in kidney cancer unbalances the proximal tubule master transcription factor hub to repress proximal tubule differentiation.

Nonsmall cell lung cancer carrying PBRM1 mutation suggests an immunologically cold phenotype leading to immunotherapy failure even with high TMB.
PBRM1 bromodomains associate with RNA to facilitate chromatin association.

name: polybromo 1

reactome.name: RUNX1 interacts with co-factors whose precise effect on RUNX1 targets is not known

wikipathways.name: Pathways in clear cell renal cell carcinoma

summary: This locus encodes a subunit of ATP-dependent chromatin-remodeling complexes. The encoded protein has been identified as in integral component of complexes necessary for ligand-dependent transcriptional activation by nuclear hormone receptors. Mutations at this locus have been associated with primary clear cell renal cell carcinoma. [provided by RefSeq, Feb 2012].
